Our Aims

Improve school attendance

Reduce fixed term and permanent exclusions

Reduce disruptive behaviour

Increased sense of self worth

Improve confifidence

Improve academic attainment

Develop emotional literacy and self-regulation

Understand the importance of nutrition, physical and mental health

Develop a ‘Growth Mindset’

Our Vision

At SPARK we believe that with dedication, encouragement and support all children and young people can achieve success and confidently prepare for adulthood.

Our aim is to coach children to be the best version of themselves and discover their potential. This means providing them with a safe and nurturing environment, that allows them to explore and develop their interests and talents as well as establish new ones.

Giving children and young people the motivation, knowledge, skills and confidence to overcome the barriers that they face will ensure they thrive and empower them to seize the opportunities that life has to offer.

Core Values

be Safe

Act in a safe and risk free manner, being careful not to cause physical or emotional harm to yourself, others or the environment.

be Persistent

Remain focused and stick with your tasks, through to completion, always look for ways to reach your goal when stuck. Never give up!

be Ambitious

Open your mind to all possibilities and be the best version of you. Have the desire and determination to achieve your success.

be Resilient

We all make mistakes! Have the confidence to learn from each experience, overcome challenges and grow.

be Kind

Use your emotional intelligence to encourage a culture of kindess that positively impacts on you and the world around you.

Assurance

It is perfectly safe and appropriate to use unregistered AP, so long as:

1

The provision has been quality assured and due diligence has taken place

2

The child remains on the roll of the substantive (commissioning) school

3

The AP is not the full time provider of all or substantially all of the child’s education

4

You visit the provision periodically throughout the duration of the placement

Our Offer

SPARK is a part time provision that works in partnership with schools and local authorities offering an additional layer of support to children and young people who are struggling to get the best from their education.

The provision is for children and young people, aged 11-16 years. Placements are short term, ranging from six to twelve weeks. Removing children from their traditional environments, we introduce them to an alternative setting and a different way of thinking.

Our curriculum does not solely focus on the pupil’s academia. It is designed to help them overcome barriers that are preventing them from engaging in their education and putting them at risk.

Through a holistic strategy and using project-based learning, which incorporates elements of National Curriculum subjects, as well as using a variety of therapeutic interventions, we focus on building confidence and aspirations and reconnecting children with their education.

Safeguarding

At SPARK the health, safety and wellbeing of every child is our top priority. We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare and safety of all pupils and expect all staffff and partners to share this commitment.

We are fully committed to ensuring that consistent, effective safeguarding procedures are in place to support pupils, their families and staff at school.

We listen to our pupils and take seriously what they tell us. All provision staff are trained in Safeguarding and Child Protection, and children are made aware of the adults they can talk to if they have any concerns. Any concerns are passed through the member(s) of staff who are trained as a ‘Designated Safeguarding Lead’ in school in compliance with the ‘sharing of information’ guidance.

Sometimes we may need to share information and work in partnership with other agencies, when there are concerns about a child’s welfare. We will ensure that our concerns about our pupils are discussed with parents/carers first, unless we have reason to believe that such a move would be contrary to the child’s welfare.

We have a number of policies and procedures in place that contribute to our safeguarding commitment, including our Safeguarding and Child Protection Policy which can be viewed in the policies section on our website.
